metadata.feature_description: Verifies application has Full Trust for deep content indexing operations.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify Full Trust enables deep content indexing

steps.action: Navigated to Scheduler panel and clicked on SCHEDULER tab to view all scheduled tasks
steps.expected: Search: File Crawler task should be visible and enabled in the scheduler list
steps.actual: Search: File Crawler task is visible in the scheduler list, enabled with frequency 'Every 1 Day' and next start scheduled for 2/10/2026

steps.action: Clicked on Task History icon for Search: File Crawler to view execution history
steps.expected: Task history should show successful runs with deep indexing statistics if Full Trust is available, or warning message if not available
steps.actual: Task history shows successful execution with: 'Number of files deep indexed: 5', 'Number of files shallow indexed: 71', 'Number of failed deep indexes: 0', and 'File Crawler Finished' message. No Full Trust warning message present, confirming Full Trust is available and deep indexing is working.

observations: Full Trust Verification is an internal runtime check that occurs during File Crawler scheduled task execution, not a dedicated UI setting page.
The feature checks for unmanaged code permission using SecurityPolicy.HasUnManagedCodePermission() method.
When Full Trust is available, deep content indexing extracts file contents for search. When not available, only file names are indexed (shallow indexing).

Code in FileCrawler.cs line 72-75 shows that if Full Trust is NOT available, a warning 'FileCrawler - Warning, filecrawler requires full trust to index files. Only file names will be used for indexing.' would be logged.
The test environment has Full Trust enabled as evidenced by successful deep indexing (5 files deep indexed) and absence of the Full Trust warning message in task history.

The suggested test scenarios 'Handle Medium Trust gracefully', 'Fallback to shallow indexing', and 'Display trust level warnings' cannot be tested in a Full Trust environment without modifying server security policy, which is outside the scope of UI testing.
